usefulItems: 900 g loaf tin (2 lb), skewer, wire rack, aluminium foil, oven
title: Chocolate Chip Cake

ingredients.content: 170 g butter, soft, plus extra for greasing
350 g plain flour, plus extra for dusting
150 g dark chocolate, small pieces or callets

preparations.content: Preheat oven to 180°C and grease a large loaf tin (900 g/2 lb) then dust with flour.
Place chocolate in mixing bowl and chop <b>5 sec/speed 6<b>. Transfer to a bowl and set aside.
Place sugar and vanilla pod in mixing bowl then grind <b>30 sec/speed 10<b>. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add butter and eggs then mix <b>1 min/speed 4<b>.
Add flour, milk and baking powder then mix <b>20 sec/speed 5<b>. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.

Add reserved chopped chocolate then stir in with spatula. Transfer to prepared loaf tin then bake for 45-55 minutes (180°C) until golden brown and a skewer inserted in centre comes out clean, covering with foil after 30 minutes to prevent top from browning too much. Allow to cool in tin for 10 minutes before transferring to a wire rack to cool completely.
Decorate with icing if desired (see tip) then slice to serve.

hintsAndTricks: You can make a chocolate ganache to cover the cake if desired: Place 100 g chocolate in mixing bowl and grate <b>10 sec/speed 8<b>. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula. Add 80 g double cream and melt <b>2 min/50°C<b>/speed 3<b>. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula then melt again <b>1 min/50°C/speed 3<b>. Once cake has cooled, decorate.
